snippet: As the debate over immigration reform continues, more than 4.4 million legal immigrants languish in a broken visa system.
abstract: Congress's debate over immigration reform continues to focus on illegal immigrants, but more than 4.4 million aspiring legal immigrants are languishing in backlogs in a broken visa system; broad bill passed by Senate in June includes ambitious measures to eliminate green card backlogs and create a new merit program, but House Republicans have made it clear they will not take up that bill.
lead_paragraph: As the debate over immigration reform continues, more than 4.4 million legal immigrants languish in a broken visa system.

headline.main: Legal Immigrants Seek Reward for Years of Following the Rules
headline.print_headline: Legal Immigrants Seek Reward For Years of Following the Rules
